evolve::Matrix

evolve::Matrix Namespace Reference

Detailed Description

A set of methods that perform matrix operations (matrices are represented by vectors) They are expected to be laid out like so:
0 1 2
3 4 5
7 8 9
.


Functions

 Generates the normal from three points like so: (p1 - p2) x (p1 - p3) To get normal facing the other way, just negate the points are assumed to have 3 coordinates (to be in a 3-manifold).

template<class T>
static vector<T> evolve::Matrix::getNormal ( const vector< T > &  p1,
const vector< T > &  p2,
const vector< T > &  p3,
bool  printDebug = true,
bool  doNotify = false 
) [inline, static]

Generates the normal from three points like so: (p1 - p2) x (p1 - p3) To get normal facing the other way, just negate the points are assumed to have 3 coordinates (to be in a 3-manifold).

Parameters:
p1 the first point
p2 the second point
p3 the third point
Returns:
(p1 - p2) x (p1 - p3)

template<class T>
static void evolve::Matrix::initializePoint ( vector< T > &  pt,
T  x,
T  y,
T  z 
) [inline, static]

handy function to initialize a vector to a point Does: pt.push_back( x ); pt.push_back( y ); pt.push_back( z ); Note that repeated calls can be used to initialize a matrix

Parameters:
pt the vector to add the coordinates to
x the first element pushed back
y the second element pushed back
z the third element pushed back

template<class T>
static vector<T> evolve::Matrix::vector3Rotate ( const vector< T > &  vec,
const vector< T > &  rotateAxis,
double  degree,
bool  printDebug = true,
bool  doNotify = false 
) [inline, static]

vector3Rotate rotates about an almost-arbitrary axis: the axis is assumed to have one of its endpoints at at the origin (simplifies/speeds the calcuation and serves our purposes)

Parameters:
vec the vector to rotate
rotateAxis the axis to rotate the vector about
degree the amount to rotate the vector (in degrees)
Returns:
the rotated vector thanks to http://www.mines.edu/~gmurray/ArbitraryAxisRotation/ArbitraryAxisRotation.html

double  degree,
bool  printDebug = true,
bool  doNotify = false 
) [inline, static]

Rotates the given vector around the Y axis.

Parameters:
vec the vector to rotate (must be a 3 dimensinal vector)
degree How many degrees to rotate the vector (in degrees)
